definition: a fortune in misfortune/a positive in the negative
to turn out just as one predicted or feared
to meet with disaster/to die tragically

sentences.english: The pity of it is that an intelligent man appears to have been seduced by the sound of his own voice.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，這位智者似乎被自己的聲音誤導了。

sentences.english: He died in 1892, his death being considered as a national calamity.
sentences.chinese: 他死於1892年，他的逝世被認爲是舉國的不幸。

sentences.english: Sadly enough, the generator was all but forgotten during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 但不幸的是，這些機器在二戰期間被完全遺忘廢置。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, however, of great luck, it's been non-circulating Rubbings .
sentences.chinese: 然而不幸中的大幸是，它的拓本一直在民間流傳。

sentences.english: Those misfortunes almost deprived him of his reason.
sentences.chinese: 那些不幸事件幾乎使他失去理智。

sentences.english: We unfortunately don't have a blood test or an X-ray to confirm it.
sentences.chinese: 很不幸，我們沒有血液測試或X光測試來證實這種病。

sentences.english: Unfortunately the photo is a bit dark, so cannot see the reception clearly.
sentences.chinese: 很不幸像片拍得有些暗，所以看不清前臺。

sentences.english: Thisis the first generation of people who have grown up with bad divorces.
sentences.chinese: 這是第一代在成長過程中目睹了很多不幸婚姻的人。

sentences.english: At first, I agreed we truly were the 'unluckiest generation,' " says Wang Xiping.
sentences.chinese: 最初，我也認爲我們真的是‘最不幸的一代’。

sentences.english: Unluckily, he failed to pass the exam again.
This was but the beginning of the tragedy of this pair of star-crossed lovers.
sentences.chinese: 這僅僅是這一對不幸的情人悲劇的開始。

sentences.english: My unhappy brother is cold and hungry on the moor.
sentences.chinese: 我那不幸的弟弟正在沼地上忍飢受凍。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, his wife had just given birth to a nonviable fetus .
sentences.chinese: 不幸地是，他妻子剛生下了一個不能成活的胎兒。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I don't really hit it off with my bos .
sentences.chinese: 很不幸，我和我的上司不很處得來。

sentences.english: MARGIE PEDEN Africa, unfortunately, has the highest rate of all these accidental injuries, unintentional injuries.
sentences.chinese: 很不幸，非洲所有兒童無心傷害比率最高。

sentences.english: But unfortunately, it didn't often work out.
sentences.chinese: 但是很不幸，調休經常很難實現。

definition: variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
to meet with disaster/to die tragically
misfortune does not come singly (idiom)/it never rains but it pours
to die of illness or injury despite receiving medical help
